headline.main: Unilever Says Its Socially Responsible Brands Outperform Rest
headline.print_headline: Unilever Says Its Socially Responsible Brands Outperform Rest

docs.snippet: Consumer goods maker Unilever says its brands that most fully embrace its CEO's passion for sustainability perform the best, adding fuel to its oft-repeated argument that social responsibility is good for business....

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GILLESPIE, MARY ELIZA

docs.snippet: GILLESPIE--Mary Eliza ("Woozy") Brown, 1921-2015, passed away peacefully at Hospice in Branford, CT, on May 3, 2015, in the presence of her loving children and grandchildren. Born and raised in Pittsburgh, PA, as part of the extended Brown- Howe c...
docs.lead_paragraph:
GILLESPIE--Mary Eliza

("Woozy") Brown, 1921-2015, passed away peacefully at Hospice in Branford, CT, on May 3, 2015, in the presence of her loving children and grandchildren. Born and raised in Pittsburgh, PA, as part of the extended Brown- Howe clan, she spent years during the Depression in Woodland, NY, the Botchford family homestead that remained her favorite family gathering place and trout- fishing haunt. She graduated from Chatham Hall School and was a member of the class of 1942 at Vassar College, leaving in 1941 to marry Gardner Fordyce ("Spider") Gillespie, Jr., as war loomed. She raised her family in Rye, NY, and became an accomplished artist, painting landscapes and children's portraits and continuing her work until her final weeks. She was an active member of the Silvermine Artists Guild and later served on the Killingworth, CT, Wetlands Commission. For the last 15 years, and continuing after the death of her beloved Spider, she lived in Chester, CT. She is survived by her four children (Susan Howe Gillespie, Gardner Fordyce Gillespie, III (and his wife Stevie), Nancy Clift Gillespie de la Selle (and her husband Sebastien) and Douglas Brown Gillespie (and his wife Ellie), nine grandchildren (Jennifer Kapczynski, Nathaniel Gillespie, Amy Kapczynski, Clara Gillespie Ferraro, Elise de la Selle Jones, Evan Gillespie, Violette de la Selle, Jamie Gillespie and Augusta Gillespie), and 10 great grandchildren. The family is planning a memorial celebration of Woozy's life this summer in Woodland. To sign the online guestbook please visit HawleyLincolnMemorial. com.

docs.snippet: MOLLOY--Patrick John died Saturday, May 2, 2015 after a long illness. He is survived by his wife, Maureen, his nephew Naveen Molloy and his nieces Katki Molloy Windsor, Hannah and Hayley Cloke. Patrick was born on December 16, 1941 at Mission Dolo...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOLLOY--Patrick John died Saturday, May 2, 2015 after a long illness. He is survived by his wife, Maureen, his nephew Naveen Molloy and his nieces Katki Molloy Windsor, Hannah and Hayley Cloke. Patrick was born on December 16, 1941 at Mission Dolores, San Francisco, grew up in southern California and attended Mater Dei High School in Santa Ana. He graduated from University of California at Davis, and University of Chicago. He taught sociology at Queens College, and Montclair State College, New Jersey. He became a financial analyst at Axa Equitable Life Insurance Company in New York and held this position until his retirement in 2007. His passion for books and learning led him to become a volunteer research associate at the Morgan Library and Museum. He contributed historical research and background readings for their exhibitions. His interest in architecture gave him the opportunity to give tours of St. Patrick's Cathedral, New York. The funeral mass is Wednesday, May 6 at Church of the Epiphany, 375 2nd Ave. In lieu of flowers, please make contributions to the NYU Langone Clinical Cancer Center, 160 E.34th St., New York, NY 10016.

docs.snippet: GANNON--Mary Katharine, (nee Talley), died on May 3, age 82. Devoted nurse, mother, sister and aunt. United States Air Force Veteran and friend to many. "Buttons" was the mother of Jeffrey T. Gannon, sister of Patricia Connors, Alfred J. Talley an...
docs.lead_paragraph:
GANNON--Mary Katharine,

(nee Talley), died on May 3, age 82. Devoted nurse, mother, sister and aunt. United States Air Force Veteran and friend to many. "Buttons" was the mother of Jeffrey T. Gannon, sister of Patricia Connors, Alfred J. Talley and the late John J. Talley. Funeral Mass - May 7, 1pm at Our Lady of Peace, 237 E. 62nd Street, New York, NY.

docs.snippet: RUBIN--LeRoy. Paul Taylor, his dancers, the administration and the trustees of the Paul Taylor Dance Foundation mourn the passing of LeRoy Rubin. Lee, a valued Board member for more than two decades, was a generous champion of Paul Taylor's work a...
docs.lead_paragraph:
RUBIN--LeRoy.

Paul Taylor, his dancers, the administration and the trustees of the Paul Taylor Dance Foundation mourn the passing of LeRoy Rubin. Lee, a valued Board member for more than two decades, was a generous champion of Paul Taylor's work and most recently was instrumental in the Lotos Club's honoring of the Dancemaker. We will greatly miss Lee's charm, dashing style, uncommon sense, and sense of humor. Our thoughts are with his beloved family.
